comment.author: 45104424@N00
comment._content: It seems that there were a whole range of skiffs of various lengths on the Harbour, from 6 footers up to these.  Those that still compete on the Harbour are 12 foot skiffs, 14 foot skiffs, 16 foot skiffs and 18 foot skiffs.

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content:
I find it difficult to distinguish between the various footers,  but these are fabulous photos - it occurs to me that they must be some of the earliest sports action photography.

Lavender Bay in the background, looking north.  The earth scars and new rock is from work building the North Shore railway, opened in 1893.   So this photo about then too?
